                    ### Question
                    Which of the following is the best-known metabolic function of the lung

                    ### Options
                    opa. Inactivation of serotonin
opb. Conversion of angiotensin–I to angiotensin–II
opc. Inactivation of bradykinin
opd. Metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P–450 system

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The primary metabolic function of the lungs, well-supported by medical consensus, is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II. This process is facilitated by the enzyme Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE), which is highly expressed in the endothelial cells of the lungs. The evidence paths confirm the presence of endothelial cells in the lungs and their interaction with peptidyl-dipeptidase A (another name for ACE), supporting this function.
